questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'By the end of the year, she _______ (graduate) from college.'
Spot the mistake: 'They will have eat all the food before we arrive.'
Change the sentence to future perfect tense: 'I am eating breakfast.'
Fill in the blank: 'Before you wake up, the sun _______ (rise).'
Spot the mistake: 'By tomorrow, she will has finished her project.'
Change the sentence to future perfect tense: 'They are running a marathon.'
questions.answer: They will have run a marathon.

questions.prompt: Fill in the blank: 'By next month, they _______ (be) married for 20 years.'
Spot the mistake: 'I will have read the book until Sunday.'
Change the sentence to future perfect tense: 'You are washing the car.'
questions.answer: You will have washed the car.

questions.prompt: Spot the mistake: 'He will have not visited his family.'

Change the sentence to future perfect tense: 'We are cooking dinner.'
